131.content: Astrid was on her way to dragons edge with stormfly when a terrible storm hit. First it was just pouring but it soon turned to snow, she knew she had to find somewhere to land as she and stormfly we're shivering. Finally she spotted one with only a few trees and some caves. " Down there gurl" she said and suddenly stormfly raced to the closest cave and got inside. Astrid took her axe and went outside to try and get some wood while stormfly chose a spot to sleep. Unfortunately all the trees on the island were soaked, Astrid quickly made her way back to the cave and back inside. By then stormfly was asleep and warm. Astrid had to act fast if she didn't find warmth soon she wouldn't make it. I was watching as the egg cracked open... splitting open as one long crack appeared traveling up and down the egg till it just popped apart.
As the midship boy offered the dragon some words. But the dragon looked to itself as it got rid of the egg chips that was on its hide. After that the dragon hopped off the pillow and started walking around the deck. Ridley stood in front of the below deck entry so that the dragon didn't go down in there. Everyone on the deck watched the dragon walk around the deck taking interest of the different devices on board. I frowned as the dragon seemed to ignore the midship boy even as he stuttered and tried to get its attentions... It reared on its hindlegs to get a better look at things, whether it was a pulley or face. It looked at them with interest till it came to me, looking at me... I frowned down at it in unconcealed sorrow. Seeing that it had blue eyes. "Why are you frowning?" The voice was feminine. So she spoke to me. Everyone on deck froze when she did that. The now clearly rejected midship boy gathered himself to talk to the dragon again. But I just spoke to her myself.
"Sorry I was just thinking. I am Captain Will Laurance. Do you have a name?" I said, there was no knowledge or precedent for this so I just had to go with the flow. The dragon seemed to be in thought as she cocked her head around thinking...
"I do not have a name."
"Would you like me to give you one?"
"Please."
I think of one and I thought of a dreadnaught...
"Temeraire." I said aloud... I cringe and curse myself for saying that.
"Temeraire? Yes, I am Termeraire." She nodded if the bobbing of her head on the end of her long neck is a nod.
"I am hungry." She said.
I motion for the midship boy to come to me, "Well before food is brought, could we put this harness on you and the food can be brought right out." I say as I show the harness to her.
She looked over it, "Very well, but I am very hungry." She said as she stood waiting for it.
I quickly got it on her and arranged it in a few minutes. After it was on and a chain was hooked on the food was brought right out. She eagerly aproached the trough and daintily started eating. She seemed to enjoy the intestines when she got to them, but besides that she ate all that was in reach... as she was eating Ridley came to me and asked, "Should I dismiss the men?"
"Ridley I believe that we should, but for her sake and the sake of the ship. I am giving you the position of captain."

"I am sure." I say as I slip off my rank keeping one in my pocket and pinning the other on him.
"Thank you sir." He said as he went to dismissing the men. I then look to Temeriare as she is licking herself after her meal. I smile and go to her. She then shook the chain.
"I would like to go flying now, and I can't with this on me." she said.
"I am sorry but right now isn't safe as we are quiet far from land."
"Oh, then where are we?"
I think... a few hundred miles from isle Meruta. It would take us about three weeks to reach.
"The nearest land that there is, is about three weeks away. We are on the ocean."
"Oh, then what can we do?"

After fumbling with numb fingers and having Temeraire tetter on the edge of falling on me, Ridley was there with a knife and cut the strap. I breath a sigh of relief as she came down over me. She looked to me and she helped me to my feet she let me on her back and walked to her place on the ship. After she did that she laid down and offered her wing so that I may get under it... I find it in myself to congratulate her on her accomplishment. "That was well done."

The next day saw me on her back again this time with some reigns and a compass. "We could get a few nets made..." Ridley offered

He subsided as I tighted the last strap and checked my set up again.

I nod and smile, "Yes." She took off after I said yes. I guided her a certain direction. "We have to keep to the east or north as we don't want to meet up with any french patrols.
She nodded. She seemed ready to fight but agreed to any plan I had... was it youth or was she only at the needed level of bloodthirstiness to fight?

"I don't know about your abilities girl, nor do I want to explain why I have you and not the ship."
"Oh."
"We might also be seen as hostile as we don't have any markers or signals to say that we are friendly."
She nodded and continued on the course to the ship.

We landed... I was asked if our flight was a success. It was so I said so...
